entry.title: New release for Nautical Backup: v2.8.1
entry.content:
What's Changed

  • Update docs by @renovate in https://github.com/Minituff/nautical-backup/pull/376
  • Update dependency mkdocs-material to v9.5.45 by @renovate in https://github.com/Minituff/nautical-backup/pull/378
  • Update dependency uvicorn to v0.32.1 by @renovate in https://github.com/Minituff/nautical-backup/pull/379

Full Changelog: https://github.com/Minituff/nautical-backup/compare/v2.8.0...v2.8.1

entry.title: New release for Nautical Backup: v2.9.0
entry.content:
Requested by https://github.com/Minituff/nautical-backup/issues/380 Thank you to @mrjk for help of troubleshooting and PR review.

New Environment Variable

Container Backup Date vs Nautical Start Date

Use the precise date for formatting the destination folder When false, use the time Nautical started the backup (not when the container was backed up).

Default: false

properties USE_CONTAINER_BACKUP_DATE=true

Understanding USE_CONTAINER_BACKUP_DATE.

Let's say you have the following format: DEST_DATE_FORMAT=%Y-%m-%d_%H-%M-%S

Since the timing is so precise (using seconds) we may get a result like this: python -- src |-- 2024-11-24_14-26-43 |-- 2024-11-24_14-26-44 |-- 2024-11-24_14-28-10

But what we actually want is a result like this: ```python -- src |-- 2024-11-24_14-26-43

The folder that was here is now within in 2024-11-24_14-26-43 folder

|-- 2024-11-24_14-28-10 ```

By setting USE_CONTAINER_BACKUP_DATE=false, then the date used will be the time Nautical actually started, not the time when each container is processed. Meaning that even if the containers take a few minutes to backup, the folder format will remain the same for each of them.

What Else Changed

  • Update minituff/nautical-backup Docker tag to v2.8.1 by @renovate in https://github.com/Minituff/nautical-backup/pull/381
  • Add USE_CONTAINER_BACKUP_DATE by @Minituff in https://github.com/Minituff/nautical-backup/pull/382
  • Update docker/metadata-action action to v5.6.1 by @renovate in https://github.com/Minituff/nautical-backup/pull/377
  • Update codecov/codecov-action action to v5 by @renovate in https://github.com/Minituff/nautical-backup/pull/372

Full Changelog: https://github.com/Minituff/nautical-backup/compare/v2.8.1...v2.9.0

entry.title: New release for Nautical Backup: v2.9.1
entry.content:
What's Changed

Thank you to @mrjk for finding the bug, and submitting a PR (https://github.com/Minituff/nautical-backup/pull/385) to fix the bug.

This update fixes a bug when override-source-dir and USE_DEST_DATE_FOLDER were both enabled, then the override would be ignored.

What Else Changed

  • Update docs by @renovate in https://github.com/Minituff/nautical-backup/pull/385
  • Fix ignored override-source-dir when USE_DEST_DATE_FOLDER=true by @mrjk in https://github.com/Minituff/nautical-backup/pull/384
  • Add test for: Fix ignored override-source-dir when USE_DEST_DATE_FOLDER=true by @Minituff in https://github.com/Minituff/nautical-backup/pull/386

New Contributors

  • @mrjk made their first contribution in https://github.com/Minituff/nautical-backup/pull/384

Full Changelog: https://github.com/Minituff/nautical-backup/compare/v2.9.0...v2.9.1
